name: B'stilla à l'Aubergine
recipeIngredients: 1 pound lamb or beef (about 8 oz), finely chopped
recipeInstructions: Cut the aubergines in half lengthwise and brush with olive oil.
Roast the aubergines on a baking sheet for about 30 minutes, or until tender.
While the aubergines are roasting, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the onions, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, turmeric, paprika, and cayenne pepper to the skillet. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the onions are lightly browned.
Stir in the lamb or beef, garlic, parsley, cilantro, and feta cheese (if using).
Roll out the puff pastry on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch. Brush the edges of the pastry with water.
Place the roasted aubergines on one half of the pastry, leaving a 1-inch border around them.
Spoon the lamb or beef mixture over the aubergines.
Brush the edges of the pastry with more water and fold the other half of the pastry over the filling to form a triangle.
Press the edges together to seal the b'stilla and use a knife to cut a few slits in the top for steam to escape.
Bake the b'stilla on a baking sheet for about 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown.
Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.
description: This Moroccan-inspired savory pie is filled with roasted eggplant, lamb or beef, and spices, all wrapped in flaky puff pastry. The result is a rich, satisfying dish that combines the flavors of France and Morocco.
image: A golden-brown b'stilla with a flaky crust and a slice cut out to reveal the savory filling.
